title: Virtual Reality-Based Hip Fracture Surgery Simulation Training Program

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Learners bring their own VR equipment to progressively master complex surgical procedures and develop cognitive load management strategies through failure experiences

learning_goals: Achieve 13 consecutive successes at each stage (beginner-intermediate-advanced) in a 3-tier complexity VR simulation.
Subjective cognitive load reduced by 20% as measured by NASA-TLX and PAAS surveys.
Objective cognitive load improved by 15% through secondary task response time testing.
Mastery of dynamic hip screw fixation procedures across 24 variant patient cases.
Diagnose failure factors and establish corrective strategies through real-time performance analysis.

resources: High-Performance VR Headset and Haptic Devices
Three-Tier Complexity Hip Fracture Simulation Software
Secondary Task System for Cognitive Load Measurement

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
